Sheet1.Summary: A boy who has experienced many losses in his life grows to manhood and enters into a love triangle with a woman and his boyhood friend.

Sheet1.Summary: Follows two New York city couples -- one heterosexual and one gay who explore the peaks and the valleys of their respective relationships.

Sheet1.Title: All You Need Is Love
Sheet1.Summary: Young man returns to his hometown to marry his male partner, while family and neighbors deal with the news.

Sheet1.Title: Big Eden
Sheet1.Summary: Big Eden is a small, fictional northwestern Montana town.

Sheet1.Title: Boys on Film 11: We Are Animals
Sheet1.Summary: A series of eight short films dealing with the varied experiences of gay men and boys.

Sheet1.Title: Breakfast with Scot
Sheet1.Summary: Eric, a sports announcer and former hockey player, doesn't know how to deal with the flamboyant young boy to whom he and his partner suddenly become guardians.

Sheet1.Title: Brokeback Mountain
Sheet1.Summary: Ennis and Jack are two shepherds who develop a sexual and emotional relationship. Their relationship becomes complicated when both of them get married to their respective girlfriends.

Sheet1.Summary: A lawyer in his 30s named Danny still dreams about becoming a cowboy when his fiancée leaves him on the eve of their wedding ceremony. Fortunately, for him, not one, but two contrasting ...                See full summary »

Sheet1.Title: Dallas Buyers Club
Sheet1.Summary: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

Sheet1.Title: From Beginning to End
Sheet1.Summary: Two brothers develop a very close relationship as they are growing up in an idyllic and happy family. When they are young adults their relationship becomes very intimate, romantic, and sexual.

Sheet1.Title: Dorian Blues
Sheet1.Summary: High school senior Dorian begins a gay man's odyssey when he determines that he's gay and decides to come out. Chief among concerns is the reaction of his father, who has never liked him.

Sheet1.Title: Dream Boy
Sheet1.Summary: Chronicles the relationship between two gay teenagers in the rural south in the late '70s.

Sheet1.Title: Speechless
Sheet1.Summary: A guy is found by the police swimming naked. He can't, or refuses to, speak and is sent to a hospital. Since no diagnosis can be made, he will be transferred to a mental hospital, when his ...                See full summary »

Sheet1.Title: East Side Story
Sheet1.Summary: The arrival of Anglo newcomers to an East L.A. Latino neighborhood rocks the quiet world of a handsome young local who is torn between the family restaurant and life as a big city chef.

Sheet1.Title: Eating Out
Sheet1.Summary: After getting dumped by his slutty girlfriend, Caleb falls in love with Gwen. However, thanks to Caleb's roommate, Gwen thinks he's gay and sets him up with her roommate, Marc.

Sheet1.Title: Eternal Summer
Sheet1.Summary: Two best friends Shane and Jonathan learn more about themselves in an ever evolving sexuality.

Sheet1.Title: For a Lost Soldier
Sheet1.Summary: Set in The Netherlands at the end of WW II, this touching story, told in flashbacks, explores the complex and romantic relationship between an adult soldier and a displaced, lonely adolescent boy.

Sheet1.Title: Freier Fall
Sheet1.Summary: A soon-to-be-father policeman falls for a gay fellow officer and his life starts falling apart.

Sheet1.Title: Strawberry and Chocolate
Sheet1.Summary: This Oscar nominated film is the story of two men who are opposites, one gay, the other straight, one a fierce communist, the other a fierce individualist, one suspicious, the other accepting, and how they come to love each other.

Sheet1.Title: Gerontophilia
Sheet1.Summary: A young man begins exploring his attraction to much much older men while working in a nursing home.

Sheet1.Title: Get Real
Sheet1.Summary: A tenderly romantic coming-of-age story as two boys in a British school fall in love.

Sheet1.Title: Going Down in LA-LA Land
Sheet1.Summary: A fresh face comes to Hollywood to act in movies but only the gay porn studios are eager to provide him with work.

Sheet1.Title: Gone, But Not Forgotten
Sheet1.Summary: Questions about the identity of an amnesiac (Matthew Montgomery) threaten his romance with the park ranger (Aaron Orr) who rescued him.

Sheet1.Title: Happy Together
Sheet1.Summary: A couple take a trip to Argentina but both men find their lives drifting apart in opposite directions.

Sheet1.Title: I Am Happiness on Earth
Sheet1.Summary: Emiliano looks at his life with the eyes of a film director, mixing the objective reality with the processes of the artistic creation. The story he is filming flounders with his daily life,...                See full summary »

Sheet1.Title: Imagine Me & You
Sheet1.Summary: A newlywed bride becomes infatuated with another woman who questions her sexual orientation, promoting a stir among the bride's family and friends.

Sheet1.Title: Is It Just Me?
Sheet1.Summary: A socially shunned columnist finds his romantic match online, but messaging under the wrong account causes his sleazy roommate's picture to be forwarded, creating an identity mix-up.

Sheet1.Title: Jet Boy
Sheet1.Summary: A drug dealer finds an unlikely traveling companion in a runaway kid trying to dodge social services.

Sheet1.Title: Keep the Lights On
Sheet1.Summary: In Manhattan, film-maker Erik bonds with closeted lawyer Paul after a fling. As their relationship becomes one fueled by highs, lows, and dysfunctional patterns, Erik struggles to negotiate his own boundaries while being true to himself.

Sheet1.Title: Kill Your Darlings
Sheet1.Summary: A murder in 1944 draws together the great poets of the beat generation: Allen Ginsberg, Jack Kerouac, and William Burroughs.

Sheet1.Title: Kiss the Bride
Sheet1.Summary: Matt is shocked to learn that his ex-boyfriend Ryan is getting married, and he makes plans to rescue him from whatever "she-devil" has lured him into this huge mistake.

Sheet1.Title: Latter Days
Sheet1.Summary: A promiscuous gay party animal falls for a young Mormon missionary, leading to crisis, cliché, and catastrophe.

Sheet1.Title: Lilting
Sheet1.Summary: A young man of Chinese-Cambodian descent dies, leaving behind his isolated mother and his 4-year male lover, who grieve but don't speak a lick of each other's language.

Sheet1.Title: Mysterious Skin
Sheet1.Summary: A teenage hustler and a young man obsessed with alien abductions cross paths, together discovering a horrible, liberating truth.

Sheet1.Title: Something Must Break
Sheet1.Summary: A gritty story taking place in Stockholm, about the passionate love between the self-abusive Sebastian who wants to be a woman, and the easy-going Andreas who is certainly not gay.

Sheet1.Title: North Sea Texas
Sheet1.Summary: A teenage boy's search for love finds him fixated on a boy who lives nearby.

Sheet1.Title: Out in the Dark
Sheet1.Summary: A drama centered on the love affair between two men on opposite sides of the Mid-East conflict: Palestinian student Nimer and Roy, an Israeli lawyer.

Sheet1.Title: Holding the Man
Sheet1.Summary: The warm, funny and achingly sad story of the 15-year-long love affair between Timothy Conigrave and the boy he fell in love with at high school, John Caleo.

Sheet1.Title: Paris Is Burning
Sheet1.Summary: A chronicle of New York's drag scene in the 1980s, focusing on balls, voguing and the ambitions and dreams of those who gave the era its warmth and vitality.

Sheet1.Title: Parting Glances
Sheet1.Summary: As Michael and Robert, a gay couple in New York, prepare for Robert's departure for a two-year work assignment in Africa, Michael must face Robert's true motives for leaving while dealing ...                See full summary »

Sheet1.Title: Patrik, Age 1.5
Sheet1.Summary: A Swedish gay couple adopt what they think is an 18-month-old orphan, only to meet their new son, a 15-year-old homophobic delinquent.

Sheet1.Title: Plan B
Sheet1.Summary: After girlfriend Laura dumps him for another man, Bruno plots to come between the new lovers. But his plan takes an unexpected turn, causing Bruno to question his own sexuality.

Sheet1.Title: Pride
Sheet1.Summary: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.

Sheet1.Title: Shelter
Sheet1.Summary: When his college dreams are sidelined by family obligations, a young man finds comfort in surfing with his best friend's brother.

Sheet1.Title: Beauty
Sheet1.Summary: Portrait of a closeted gay husband/father living a life of quiet middle-aged desperation who becomes fixated on a friend's handsome collegiate son, leading to an incident.

Sheet1.Title: Snails in the Rain
Sheet1.Summary: Tel Aviv, Summer 1989. Boaz, a beautiful and alluring linguistics student, receives anonymous, male-written, love letters that undermines his sexual identity and interfere with his peaceful life with his beloved girlfriend.

Sheet1.Title: Steam: The Turkish Bath
Sheet1.Summary: Francesco inherits an old palace from a Turkish aunt and moves to Istanbul to renovate it.

Sheet1.Title: Stranger by the Lake
Sheet1.Summary: Summertime. A cruising spot for men, tucked away on the shores of a lake. Franck falls in love with Michel, an attractive, potent and lethally dangerous man. Franck knows this but wants to live out his passion anyway.

Sheet1.Title: Tropical Malady
Sheet1.Summary: A romance between a soldier and a country boy, wrapped around a Thai folk-tale involving a shaman with shape-shifting abilities.

Sheet1.Title: Summer Storm
Sheet1.Summary: A close friendship between two crew teammates is tested when one slowly discovers he's gay and attracted to the other.

Sheet1.Title: The Bubble

Sheet1.Title: His Secret Life
Sheet1.Summary: After a deathly car accident, Antonia starts dating her husband's friends and finds the truth about his life.

Sheet1.Title: The Kids Are All Right
Sheet1.Summary: Two children conceived by artificial insemination bring their biological father into their non-traditional family life.

Sheet1.Title: The Sum of Us
Sheet1.Summary: A widowed father has to deal with two complex issues: while he is searching for "Miss Right," his son, who is in his 20s and gay, is searching for "Mr. Right."

Sheet1.Title: The Way He Looks
Sheet1.Summary: Leonardo is a blind teenager searching for independence. His everyday life, the relationship with his best friend, Giovana, and the way he sees the world change completely with the arrival of Gabriel.

Sheet1.Title: The Birdcage
Sheet1.Summary: A gay cabaret owner and his drag queen companion agree to put up a false straight front so that their son can introduce them to his fiancée's right-wing moralistic parents.

Sheet1.Title: The Falls
Sheet1.Summary: The Falls is a feature film about two missionaries that fall in love while on their mission.

Sheet1.Title: The Falls: Testament of Love
Sheet1.Summary: Chris and RJ reunite five years after coming out to their families and their church as gay men, where the factors that led to their separation are revealed as they mourn the death of their mutual friend Rodney.

Sheet1.Title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
Sheet1.Summary: In late 1950s New York, Tom Ripley, a young underachiever, is sent to Italy to retrieve Dickie Greenleaf, a rich and spoiled millionaire playboy. But when the errand fails, Ripley takes extreme measures.

Sheet1.Title: Time to Leave
Sheet1.Summary: A fashion photographer with terminal cancer elects to die alone, preparing others to live past him rather than prolong the inevitable with chemotherapy or be smothered in sympathy by those who know him.

Sheet1.Title: Undertow
Sheet1.Summary: An unusual ghost story set on the Peruvian seaside; a married fisherman struggles to reconcile his devotion to his male lover within his town's rigid traditions.

Sheet1.Title: Weekend
Sheet1.Summary: After a drunken house party with his straight mates, Russell heads out to a gay club. Just before closing time he picks up Glen but what's expected to be just a one-night stand becomes something else, something special.

Sheet1.Title: Were the World Mine
Sheet1.Summary: A bullied and demoralized gay student at an all-boys school uses a magical flower derived from Shakespeare's "A Midsummer Night's Dream' to turn many in his community gay, including a comely rugby player for himself.

Sheet1.Title: XXY
Sheet1.Summary: The story of an intersex fifteen-year-old. She lives with her parents, who have to cope with the challenges of her medical condition.

Sheet1.Title: You Are Not Alone
Sheet1.Summary: Two precocious boys explore their sexuality at boarding school.

Sheet1.Title: All Over the Guy
Sheet1.Summary: "All Over The Guy" is a contemporary romantic comedy about the quest to find the "one" when "the one" doesn't know he's the "one." It explores the unlikely pairing of two 20-somethings ...                See full summary »

Sheet1.Title: Beautiful Thing
Sheet1.Summary: Jamie is a shy teenager, often bullied at school. His neighbour Ste has a rough time at home, being beaten by his father and brother. This issues bring them together and they find that what they feel for each other is more than friendship.

Sheet1.Title: Bent
Sheet1.Summary: In 1930s Berlin, a gay Jew is sent to a concentration camp under the Nazi regime.

Sheet1.Title: Boyfriends
Sheet1.Summary: Paul, Matt, and Will (in their 30s) have been friends for years. They converge at the seaside for the weekend, each with a boyfriend in tow. Paul is with Ben, his companion of five years: ...                See full summary »

Sheet1.Title: C.R.A.Z.Y.
Sheet1.Summary: A young French Canadian, one of five boys in a conservative family in the 1960s and 1970s, struggles to reconcile his emerging identity with his father's values.

Sheet1.Title: Call Me by Your Name
Sheet1.Summary: In 1980s Italy, romance blossoms between a seventeen-year-old student and the older man hired as his father's research assistant.

Sheet1.Title: Christopher and His Kind
Sheet1.Summary: How real-life British-American author Christopher Isherwood and his German boyfriend Heinz met and fell in love during the 1930s and the rise of Nazism.

Sheet1.Title: Eastern Boys
Sheet1.Summary: A businessman makes a regular arrangement with a Ukrainian prostitute, despite the youngster's involvement in a controlling street gang.

Sheet1.Title: Eyes Wide Open
Sheet1.Summary: A married, Orthodox, Jerusalem butcher and Jewish father of four falls in love with his handsome, 22-year-old male apprentice, triggering the suspicions of his wife and the disapproval of his Orthodox community.

Sheet1.Title: Five Dances
Sheet1.Summary: The coming of age tale of an extraordinarily gifted young dancer recently arrived in New York City.

Sheet1.Title: Hawaii
Sheet1.Summary: Martin seeks for a temporary job at Eugenio's house. When they recognize to be childhood friends, Eugenio offers him work for the summer. A power and desire game starts and their relationship grows beyond their friendship.

Sheet1.Title: I Love You Phillip Morris
Sheet1.Summary: A cop turns con man once he comes out of the closet. Once imprisoned, he meets the second love of his life, whom he'll stop at nothing to be with.

Sheet1.Title: David's Birthday
Sheet1.Summary: Two couples are enjoying their summer at the beach, but when the grown son of one couple arrives, it surprisingly stirs something in the husband of the other couple, will the forbidden feelings end badly?

Sheet1.Title: Junjô
Sheet1.Summary: Through a coincidence Tozaki runs into Kurata, his first crush from high school. They begin a relationship, but Kurata's jealousy starts causing problems.

Sheet1.Title: Bad Education
Sheet1.Summary: An examination on the effect of Franco-era religious schooling and sexual abuse on the lives of two longtime friends.

Sheet1.Title: Looking
Sheet1.Summary: The experiences of three close friends living and loving in modern-day San Francisco.

Sheet1.Title: Mambo Italiano
Sheet1.Summary: The son of Italian immigrants to Canada struggles to find the best way to reveal to his parents that he's gay.

Sheet1.Title: Maurice
Sheet1.Summary: After his lover rejects him, a young man trapped by the oppressiveness of Edwardian society tries to come to terms with and accept his sexuality.

Sheet1.Title: Monster Pies
Sheet1.Summary: Mike has felt alienated and alone for as long as he can remember, until a new boy arrives at his school - awakening feelings and a world of possibilities he'd never before dared to dream of.

Sheet1.Title: Futuro Beach
Sheet1.Summary: Shortly after failing to rescue a drowning man, Donato meets Konrad, a friend of the victim. They soon begin a relationship which seems doomed from the start, while Donato's past catches up with him.

Sheet1.Title: Prayers for Bobby
Sheet1.Summary: True story of Mary Griffith, gay rights crusader, whose teenage son committed suicide due to her religious intolerance. Based on the book of the same title by Leroy Aarons.

Sheet1.Title: Save Me
Sheet1.Summary: A sex and drug-addicted young man who is forced into a Christian-run ministry in an attempt to cure him of his "gay affliction," where instead he is faced with the truth in his heart and spirit.

Sheet1.Title: Shortbus
Sheet1.Summary: A group of New Yorkers caught up in their romantic-sexual milieu converge at an underground salon infamous for its blend of art, music, politics, and carnality.

Sheet1.Title: The Crying Game
Sheet1.Summary: A British soldier kidnapped by IRA terrorists soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.

Sheet1.Title: The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Sheet1.Summary: A young gay man tries to balance his career as a personal assistant while searching for love.

Sheet1.Title: The Normal Heart
Sheet1.Summary: A gay activist attempts to raise H.I.V. and A.I.D.S. awareness during the early 1980s.

Sheet1.Title: The Skinny
Sheet1.Summary: Director Patrik-Ian Polk provides exciting character developments, brilliant cinematography and life lessons for all, particularly for members of the black LGBT community. Cameos by key actors from the Noah Arc series are visual delights.

Sheet1.Title: Trick
Sheet1.Summary: The misadventures of two young gay men, trying to find a place to be alone, one night in Manhattan.

Sheet1.Title: Yossi & Jagger
Sheet1.Summary: Romance blooms between two soldiers (Knoller, Levi) stationed in an Israeli outpost on the Lebanese border.

Sheet1.Title: Yossi
Sheet1.Summary: This sequel to Yossi and Jagger finds Dr. Yossi Gutmann reminiscing about his love ten years after his death; however, as he encounters a group of young soldiers, one of them, Tom, reignites his romantic feelings.

Sheet1.Title: Tomboy
Sheet1.Summary: A family moves into a new neighborhood, and a 10-year-old named Laure deliberately presents as a boy named Mikhael to the neighborhood children.
